author: Zacks
title: Why Iovance Biotherapeutics Stock Popped Today
text:
Motley Fool Why Iovance Biotherapeutics Stock Popped Today Read full article Steve Symington, The Motley Fool December 29, 2023 at 12:59 AM ¬∑ 2 min read
Shares of Iovance Biotherapeutics (NASDAQ: IOVA) popped 18.7% on Thursday as investors assessed the fallout of a clinical hold placed on a cancer-therapy trial yesterday by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA).
A setback for a much-needed treatment Today's rebound nearly recouped an almost 20% drop yesterday for Iovance, which came on the heels of a U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) decision to place a clinical hold on its IOV-LUN-202 clinical trial following a patient's death. The trial was evaluating Iovance's LN-145 TIL experimental therapy to treat non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC).
Iovance issued a press release explaining that the death was "potentially related to the non-myeloablative lymphodepletion pre-conditioning regimen" of the trial. At the same time, Iovance pointed out the dire need for therapies in cases such as these, noting that the patients in the trial "have a poor prognosis, limited treatment options, and a real-world overall survival of less than six months."
What's next for Iovance investors? In any case, Iovance has paused enrollment in the treatment regimen for new patients during the clinical hold, and it will continue to monitor and follow patients previously treated according to the trial protocol. The company says patients who have already undergone tumor resection will continue to receive the LN-145 TIL treatment regimen "with additional precautions and risk mitigations."
Of note from an investor's standpoint (and potentially contributing to today's rebound): LN-145 TIL isn't Iovance's lead drug candidate. Rather, more important to the company's near-term survival is its lifileucel advanced melanoma treatment, which could generate peak annual sales of as much as $900 million and for which the company expects to receive an FDA-approval decision by Feb. 24, 2024.
The potential approval of lifileucel is unrelated to LN-145 TIL's clinical trial. That's a potentially massive revenue stream for a company whose entire market cap sits at just $2.2 billion today. And opportunistic shareholders appear to be taking advantage of yesterday's drop to invest accordingly.
Story continues Should you invest $1,000 in Iovance Biotherapeutics right now?

author: Mark Mann-Bryans
title: Arsenal lose to West Ham and miss chance to return to Premier League summit | The Independent
text: Arsenal missed the chance to return to the top of the Premier League as they slipped to a disappointing defeat to West Ham amid more VAR controversy.The Gunners needed victory to replace Liverpool at the summit but lost 2-0 on a night where Hammers boss David Moyes finally landed a victory at the Emirates Stadium.West Ham lost Kurt Zouma ahead of the game and Lucas Paqueta after just over half an hour but hit the front through Tomas Soucek‚Äôs strike, awarded after VAR could not determine whether the whole ball had gone out of play in the build-up.A second-half header from former Arsenal defender Konstantinos Mavropanos secured the points and things could have been even better for the visitors had Said Benrahma not seen a last-gasp penalty saved by David Raya.Moyes had failed to secure victory in his previous 72 Premier League away games at Arsenal, Chelsea, Liverpool or Manchester United, so this was a long time coming for the Scot.Arsenal laboured when they needed to continue their recent winning run in London derbies to go back to the top of the table.Instead, only captain Martin Odegaard could hold his head high on a night where their defence creaked and Gabriel Jesus was guilty of missing a couple of very good chances.Arsenal started well, with some great touches in and around the West Ham box from Odegaard in particular.But at the other end their defending left a lot to be desired, as Oleksandr Zinchenko and Gabriel Magalhaes failed to deal with a simple ball into the middle.Jarrod Bowen capitalised by latching onto the miscue and teed up Soucek to finish ‚Äì the goal surviving a lengthy VAR check which could not ultimately make a call on if the ball had not gone out of play before Bowen‚Äôs cutback.Arsenal looked to respond although the goal gave West Ham something to defend, although Jesus found a way in behind with a subtle flick into Bukayo Saka, whose header was brilliantly saved by Alphonse Areola.Paqueta had been hurt in the warm-up and lasted just over half an hour, with his fellow Brazilian Gabriel Martinelli curling an effort just wide for Arsenal as they continued in vain to find a leveller.The hosts were getting closer, West Ham gifting possession as two passes saw Arsenal in on goal once more, this time Saka hitting the base of the post from an acute angle.Former West Ham captain Declan Rice fired just over from 25 yards but it was another player coming back to haunt his former club who would find the back of the net soon after.Mavropanos made just seven league starts in three years as an Arsenal player but returned to the Premier League last summer with the Hammers and headed them two goals ahead before the hour.Jesus then headed straight at Areola before sending another fine chance well over the bar moments after Arteta introduced Eddie Nketiah and Reiss Nelson off the bench.Areola was on hand again to keep out a Leandro Trossard effort, with Vladimir Coufal clearing a William Saliba header off the line from the resulting corner.Rice had come off the bench during a 3-0 Carabao Cup defeat on his return to West Ham earlier in the season and endured another night to forget here as he conceded a late penalty for tripping Emerson Palmieri in the box ‚Äì only for Raya to keep out substitute Benrahma‚Äôs tame spot-kick.Want to bookmark your favourite articles and stories to read or reference later? Start your Independent Premium subscription today.

author: world today news
title: Swedbank Customer Wins Cash Prize ‚Äì Find Out How and What It Means for Big Companies
text:
A customer of ‚ÄúSwedbank‚Äù received a message from the bank that he won a cash prize. He is quick to reach out to other customers to share this
information and the way forward.
Do big companies often do contests?
Yes, large companies often run contests or sweepstakes in various ways to attract attention, increase brand visibility, and promote sales of their products or services. These competitions can be different and their purpose can change depending on the company‚Äôs goals and strategy. Some common ways large companies run contests include:
Social media contests: Businesses often use social media to run contests and engage the public. These contests may include participation, participation with the fulfillment of the contest rules, packaging design, etc
Product or service offers: Some companies may run contests to obtain new customers or customer purchase inquiries by offering a product or service as a prize.
Creative contests: Businesses often invite the public to participate in creative contests, such as
photo contests, video contests, or songwriting contests, to gain content creation and attention.
Extending the brand message: Contests can also be a way to extend the brand message and engage with a specific theme or value.
Read more: Benefits for this category of Latvian residents will be increased from January 1 and it is known how much benefit will be granted
Charity contests: Some companies run contests with a charitable purpose, offering entrants the chance to win by making a donation to a specific charity.
Introduction of new products or innovations: Contests can also serve to introduce new products or innovations, where participation requires participants to complete tasks or provide creative solutions.
Contests can take a wide variety of forms and approaches and aim to create positive connections with customers, drive engagement and build brand visibility. Often, contests are also part of a marketing strategy that is adapted to certain market conditions and company goals.

news

author: Natalia Toczkowska
title: Track Your Belongings for Less: Discounted Apple AirTag Multipack
text:
Track Your Belongings for Less: Discounted Apple AirTag Multipack
In an attractive offer to tech-savvy consumers, Amazon has marked down a four-pack of Apple‚Äôs popular AirTags to just $79. This sale pricing is exceptionally competitive, reflecting a generous 20 percent cut from the usual $99 retail value. Particularly for those in constant motion, wanting to keep tabs on personal items like luggage or everyday carry-ons, this deal presents a strong opportunity to invest in Apple‚Äôs sophisticated tracking technology.
AirTags are designed to seamlessly integrate with Apple devices, such as iPhones and iPads, enabling users to easily pinpoint the location of their valuables using the Find My app. Thanks to the vast network of Apple devices and the Bluetooth technology AirTags employ, items misplaced can be located with higher probability. The added convenience of a built-in speaker allows users to audibly locate their belongings if believed to be nearby.
For iPhone users, the benefits are further amplified through the Precision Finding feature providing guided direction to their possessions. Moreover, in situations where an item is far from reach, the Lost Mode can be activated on the AirTag to send instant notifications once the item is detected by the network of devices in the vicinity.
While a standalone AirTag is currently retailing for $24, also at a reduced rate on Amazon, the quadruple package deal stands out as the most economical selection for users requiring multiple tracking devices.
Understanding that the convenience of keeping track of various valuables can often come at a premium, this current promotion on Amazon is a smart grab for customers looking to blend tech and security for their possessions without breaking the bank.
FAQ About the Amazon Sale on Apple AirTags
What are Apple AirTags?
Apple AirTags are small tracking devices designed to help users locate lost items. They work with Apple devices through the Find My app by using Bluetooth technology and the network of Apple devices.
What is the current deal on AirTags?
Amazon is offering a four-pack of Apple AirTags for $79, which is a 20 percent discount from the standard retail price of $99.
Can I purchase a single AirTag instead of the four-pack?
Yes, a single AirTag is available for $24 on Amazon, which is also a reduced price. However, the four-pack offer presents a better value for those who need multiple trackers.
What is Precision Finding?
Precision Finding is a feature for iPhone users that provides more accurate directions to their AirTagged items using ultra-wideband technology.
What happens when an item with an AirTag goes missing?
You can activate the Lost Mode on the AirTag, which will send you notifications as soon as any device in Apple‚Äôs network detects your lost item.
Are AirTags compatible with all devices?
AirTags are designed to integrate with Apple devices, like iPhones and iPads. They rely on the Find My app to work effectively.
Is this deal on Amazon a limited-time offer?
The article does not specify if the deal is limited-time. However, such discounts are often subject to availability and can end without prior notice.
Definitions:
‚Äì Bluetooth Technology: A wireless communication protocol for connecting devices over short distances.
‚Äì Find My App: An application developed by Apple that helps users locate their Apple devices and AirTags.
‚Äì Precision Finding: A feature that provides users with exact directions to their lost item through the use of ultra-wideband technology.
Insightful Analysis:
This deal reflects Amazon‚Äôs strategy to appeal to tech-savvy consumers by offering significant discounts on popular gadgets. The promotion highlights the growing market for smart devices that enhance consumer security and the convenience of locating personal belongings.
Related Link:
For more information about Apple AirTags, you may visit Apple‚Äôs official website at
Apple. Please note that URLs provided are directed to the main domain and not to specific subpages.
Natalia Toczkowska is a notable figure in digital health technology, recognized for her contributions in advancing telemedicine and healthcare apps. Her work focuses on developing innovative solutions to improve patient care and accessibility through technology. Toczkowska‚Äôs research and development in creating user-friendly, secure digital platforms have been instrumental in enhancing the effectiveness of remote medical consultations and patient monitoring. Her dedication to integrating technology in healthcare has not only improved patient outcomes but also streamlined healthcare processes, making her a key influencer in the field of digital health innovation.

title: Temporal en Salto: el "momento impactante" cuando lleg√≥ la tormenta, calles inundadas y autos aplastados
text: Desde las 21:45 del jueves hasta las 4:00 de este viernes hubo localidades de Salto que estuvieron primero bajo alerta amarilla y luego bajo alerta naranja del Instituto Uruguayo de Meteorolog√≠a ( [Inumet](https://www.elobservador.com.uy/nota/clima-en-uruguay-hoy-asi-es-el-pronostico-de-inumet-para-este-viernes-29-de-diciembre-2023122973927)) por tormentas fuertes. Se trat√≥ de una "perturbaci√≥n atmosf√©rica asociada a masa de aire h√∫meda e inestable" que afect√≥ al norte del pa√≠s "generando tormentas algunas puntualmente fuertes", explic√≥ Inumet. El instituto advirti√≥ que en zonas de tormentas se pod√≠an registrar "lluvias intensas en cortos per√≠odos, ca√≠da de granizo, intensa actividad el√©ctrica y rachas de viento muy fuertes". Varias personas registraron con im√°genes y videos la situaci√≥n en el departamento norte√±o. "En Salto, [#Uruguay](https://twitter.com/hashtag/Uruguay?src=hash&ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw), se vivi√≥ un momento impactante con un temporal de vientos superiores a 100 kil√≥metros por hora. El ruido del viento y la llegada de la tormenta se captaron en un video", dice una publicaci√≥n de la Estaci√≥n BCP. author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Patriots Week 8 Injury Update: Key Player Off Report as Jets Loom
text:
Patriots Week 8 Injury Update: Key Player Off Report as Jets Loom
The New England Patriots are navigating a wave of injuries as they prepare for their second game against the New York Jets this season. Quarterback Drake Maye, who previously faced concerns over a knee injury, has now been removed from the injury report after showing no impact on his performance. The team is seeing some positive signs with growing full participation, notably from running back Rhamondre Stevenson, crucial for the offense. Meanwhile, a significant list of players remains limited or sidelined, complicating the team's preparations.
- Maye initially appeared on the injury report due to a knee issue but is now fully cleared.
- Several players, including WR Ja'Lynn Polk and DT Daniel Ekuale, remain sidelined, indicating ongoing injury struggles.
Despite the removal of key player Maye from the injury report, the Patriots still face a challenging injury list that could impact their performance against the Jets.
State of Play- Rhamondre Stevenson is recovering and has shown full participation in practice.
- Many players are limited in practice, raising questions about their availability for the upcoming game.
As the Patriots approach their Week 8 matchup against the Jets, ongoing evaluations will determine the availability of injured players, especially key offensive contributors.
Bottom LineThe Patriots are cautiously optimistic with Maye‚Äôs recovery but must continue to monitor a lengthy injury list to ensure they have their best players ready for a crucial AFC East duel.

author: Jared Gendron
title: USPS is considering shifting Cheyenne‚Äôs mail processes to Denver. Some Wyoming officials think it‚Äôs a bad idea.
text:
CHEYENNE, Wyo. ‚Äî Several Wyoming government officials, including the governor, are concerned about the future state of Cheyenne‚Äôs postal service following a recent public forum.
Gov. Mark Gordon, Sen. Cynthia Lummis and Secretary of State Chuck Gray have recently spoken out against the United States Postal Service‚Äôs proposed plan to move some of its mail processing operations from the Cheyenne Processing and Distribution Center to Denver‚Äôs P&DC. The officials cite election integrity, mail delays and the closure of Casper‚Äôs mailing facility as reasons why they oppose any changes.
On Dec. 12, a representative with the Western USPS Mail Processing Division provided a presentation at Laramie County Community College. According to a
Nov. 21 news release from the postal service, the purpose of the event was so USPS could provide the public with results from its Mail Processing Facility Review. Key points of the review include:
- USPS support keeping the Cheyenne facility open and modernizing the facility as a local processing center.
- USPS supports transferring some mail processing operations to the Denver P&DC.
Aside from the LCCC presentation, USPS recently gathered written comments from the public via an online survey, which closed on Wednesday.
Over the past few weeks, though, Wyoming‚Äôs elected officials have made their opinions on the mailing process known. The Secretary of State said in a letter dated Dec. 27 that he opposed the mail agency‚Äôs proposed changes. Specifically, Gray states in a letter to USPS Postmaster General Louis DeJoy that he believes the changes would compromise Wyoming‚Äôs electoral process.
‚ÄúSince the Postal Service announced its proposal, our office has been contacted by numerous Wyomingites, concerned that processing Wyoming election mail in Denver would delay delivery of mail-in ballots and impede the integrity of Wyoming elections,‚Äù Gray states in the letter. ‚ÄúI have these same concerns.‚Äù
In her written statement to the postmaster general on Dec. 15, Sen. Lummis expressed her disapproval of the mail processing changes but for differing reasons. She states that moving some of Cheyenne‚Äôs mail processes to Denver would result in mailing delays.
‚ÄúFollowing the closure of the Rock Springs sorting facility, I have experienced firsthand unnecessary delays and interruptions in mail service that resulted from forcing Wyoming mail to be processed in another state,‚Äù Lummis states in her letter. She also claims that the proposal would lead to the loss of at least seven ‚Äúcraft‚Äù jobs at Cheyenne‚Äôs facility.
Finally, Gov. Mark Gordon has weighed in on the subject. In a Dec. 22 letter to the postmaster general, Gordon states he is concerned about mailing delays that could compound for Wyoming residents. The governor states that Wyoming‚Äôs only other P&DC, located in Casper, is closing in 2025.
‚ÄúWyoming‚Äôs rural residents and small businesses depend greatly upon the U.S. Postal Service,‚Äù Gordon states in the letter. ‚ÄúSmall businesses in our rural communities cannot afford delays to stay competitive in a global market.‚Äù
USPS regional spokesperson James Boxrud told Cap City News that the study presented at LCCC is not indicative of any of the agency‚Äôs final plans.
‚ÄúI can reaffirm that we are not closing our mail processing plant,‚Äù Boxrud said via email. ‚ÄúHowever, we are studying the possibility of moving a portion of our mail processing operations ‚Äî specifically the outgoing mail.‚Äù
Boxrud states that there won‚Äôt be any impact to local mail delivery and that post office hours won‚Äôt be affected as a result of potential mail processing changes. He added that jobs won‚Äôt be affected, though some bids may change.

author: AdnKronos
title: Maltempo addio, arriva lunga Ottobrata con sole in tutta Italia: previsioni meteo
text:
Maltempo addio, arriva lunga Ottobrata con sole in tutta Italia: previsioni meteo
Decisa rimonta dell'alta pressione sulla Penisola
| [AdnKronos](/archivio/news/giornalista/16145) |
Il maltempo se ne va. Dopo i primi 10 giorni di Ottobre all'insegna di piogge, allagamenti e allerta anche rossa, √® in arrivo tanto sole con una bella Ottobrata su gran parte dell'Italia. Antonio San√≤, fondatore de iLMeteo.it, conferma la decisa rimonta dell‚Äôalta pressione sull‚ÄôItalia con la cessazione delle forti piogge che hanno colpito soprattutto il Centro-Nord nella prima decade di Ottobre.
Nelle prossime ore avremo ancora qualche residuo addensamento specie sul Triveneto orientale, in Toscana e sul Basso Tirreno, accompagnato da locali piovaschi; per il resto il tempo sar√† in deciso miglioramento ovunque. Le temperature scenderanno leggermente a causa di venti pi√π freschi dai quadranti settentrionali, specie al Meridione e in Sardegna, ma torneremo a percepire il calore del sole da Nord a Sud; gli ultimi 10 giorni perturbati hanno offuscato la memoria delle belle e serene giornate autunnali di una volta a molti abitanti del Centro-Nord.
Nel weekend rivivremo queste belle giornate con il sole che torner√† ad illuminare il foliage dei boschi; a tratti, il sole sar√† disturbato da correnti pi√π umide solo al Nord-Ovest e in montagna con addensamenti comunque non forieri di precipitazioni. Temperature Lungo le coste il sole scalder√† quasi ovunque fino a valori gradevoli: sono previste massime di 28¬∞C in Sardegna e Sicilia, fino a 27¬∞C in Puglia e Calabria, 25-26¬∞C in Basilicata con Napoli e Roma a 24¬∞C, Firenze a 22¬∞C e Milano sui 20. La media delle massime di Ottobre a Milano √® 18¬∞C, sulla Capitale 22¬∞C; entro il weekend, dunque, saliremo nelle due principali citt√† italiane di 2 gradi oltre i valori climatologici.
Quanto dura
Addirittura, le ultime emissioni dei modelli indicano la possibilit√† della persistenza del bel tempo quasi fino alla fine del mese, con una lunga e mite Ottobrata su buona parte del Paese. In questa proiezione meteo ottimistica non sono esclusi due veloci passaggi un po‚Äô perturbati sia venerd√¨ 18 sia venerd√¨ 25 ottobre; per il resto l‚Äôanticiclone dovrebbe dominare e fermarsi a lungo sul nostro Paese. Ovviamente si tratta di una tendenza da confermare.
Nel dettaglio
Venerd√¨ 11. Al Nord: piovaschi sui monti emiliani, sole altrove. Al Centro: piovaschi sulla Toscana interna. Al Sud: nubi residue con locali piovaschi sulle tirreniche.
Sabato 12. Al Nord: nuvoloso. Al Centro: soleggiato. Al Sud: soleggiato.
Domenica 13. Al Nord: sole prevalente. Al Centro: soleggiato. Al Sud: bel tempo.
Tendenza: rinforzo dell‚Äôanticiclone, un po' penalizzato il Nord.
Iscriviti alla Newsletter di OggiTreviso. E' Gratis
Ogni mattina le notizie dalla tua citt√†, dalla regione, dall'Italia e dal mondo
